meanings.definition: To interfere in someone else's business.
meanings.sent1: She always likes to meddle in her sister's affairs.
meanings.sent2: Please do not meddle in my personal matters.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat decided to meddle in the dog's playtime.
meanings.sent4: His meddling in their relationship caused more harm than good.
meanings.sent5: The nosy neighbor couldn't resist meddling in the gossip.

meanings.definition: To handle or touch something without permission.
meanings.sent1: He was caught trying to meddle with the lock on the door.
meanings.sent2: It is not polite to meddle with other people's belongings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child loved to meddle with the buttons on the remote control.
meanings.sent4: The hacker attempted to meddle with the company's computer system.
meanings.sent5: The scientist warned the students not to meddle with the fragile equipment.
